{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3426379,"name":"","username":"KfirNeuman","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/k/d07c76/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-09-23T15:29:30.243Z","cooked":"

Hi my team has been trying to get our PoseEstimator working with MegaTag2 on our Limelight3G. We have managed to get the odometry and MegaTag working individually and have began trying to find good standard deviations.

The Limelight UI has a display of the standard deviations from the MegaTag. We were wondering if we could access these from our code. We searched the network tables and the Limelight documentation APIs for a way to get these values but it seems they are only on the front end. The limelight software change logs say “The 3D Field visualizer now includes MegaTag1 and Megatag2 standard deviations for x, y, and yaw.” which makes it seem like the values are only in the UI. Is this really the case and if so why is it not published to the network tables along with everything else?

Edited to fix confusing abbreviation

docs.limelightvision.io

JSON Results Specification | Limelight Documentation

Limelight's JSON results output is a collection of arrays containing targeting results. Separate arrays exist for retroreflective, fiducial, neural classifier, and neural detector results.

It looks like it dumps the stdev values into json under the stdev_mt1 and stdev_mt2 objects, which might not be accessible through NT4 but it should be easy enough to get either through http or a websocket

If the standard deviation cannot be retrieved, I think you can derive it yourself:

  1. From the mega tag result, you have a point estimate of the current robot pose, label it P.
  2. Retrieve the single Solve-PNP results from the limelight. For each tag visible, use the tag layouts to estimate the camera-to-field transform and estimate the robot poses:
    P0,P1,P2…
  3. If we take P as the average and estimate the standard deviation of p0, p1, p2, that would be the standard deviation of the pose estimate.
